answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some studies that may help answer your question.
I have included the link to the “International Source Book on Environmentally Sound Technologies for Wastewater and Stormwater Management.” At the bottom of the list you can review a case study from flat, coastal Djibouti.
http://www.unep.or.jp/ietc/publications/techpublications/techpub-15/3-1Africa/1-11_1.asp
A green method of sewage treatment that some suggest for flat areas is spray irrigation. View more information about that method below.
http://www.delawareriverkeeper.org/resources/Factsheets/Natural_Wastewater_Treatment_-_Spray_Irrigation.pdf
 The UN Environment Program has several wastewater resources which may be helpful.
http://www.unep.or.jp/ietc/WS/publications.asp
I also included a consultant’s assessment of wastewater treatment in Colombo, Sri Lanka.
http://www.adb.org/Documents/Reports/Consultant/36173-SRI/36173-SRI-TACR.pdf
I hope these help!
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Octavio Chavez
text: ICMA LA is working with the Municipality of Navolato on the Mexican Pacific Ocean side. They have a relatively large community which is located in a very flat area next to the shoreline. We would like to learn how other communities with a similar situation are addressing the sewage issues.
title: Sewage service in low seashore areas
